column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////In regards to the 50-cent charge for reheating your soup: First and foremost
column2: if a customer has any issue with their food
column3: we will do everything in our power to make it right. However
column4: we don't charge customers to reheat their food. That
column6: defies logic. Perhaps you requested that your ramen be made "spicy" or "hot"? If so
column7: that is where the 50-cent charge would have been applied as the chili paste we use comprises more than 15 different ingredients and requires a significant amount of labor to prepare. Ordering this extra chili paste is comparable to ordering sour cream at a Tex-Mex restaurant -- it's rarely free
column8: but instead carries a nominal fee.
